---
category: news
title: "Pātea writer big winner at Ronald Hugh Morrieson Literary Awards"
excerpt: "Airana Ngarewa was the big winner at the Literary Awards in Hāwera on Wednesday night. The Pātea writer, who teaches at New Plymouth’s Spotswood College, won the open section of the short story competition with A casket made of flax and the open section of the poetry competition with Poi E Won’t Break Your Heart."
